posts.title: ADCS ESC1 Vulnerability Deep Dive
posts.excerpt: Exploiting Misconfigured Certificate Templates for Domain Privilege Escalation. Learn how to identify and exploit ESC1 vulnerabilities in Active Directory Certificate Services.

posts.title: ADCS ESC2: Certificate Templates with Any Purpose EKU
posts.excerpt: Understanding how certificate templates with 'Any Purpose' Extended Key Usage can be abused for authentication and privilege escalation.

posts.title: ADCS ESC3: Enrollment Agent Abuse
posts.excerpt: Exploiting Enrollment Agent certificate templates to request certificates on behalf of other users and gain unauthorized access.

posts.title: ADCS ESC4: Writeable Certificate Templates
posts.excerpt: How attackers can modify certificate templates with write permissions to create vulnerable configurations for privilege escalation.

posts.title: ADCS ESC6: EDITF_ATTRIBUTESUBJECTALTNAME2 Abuse
posts.excerpt: Exploiting the dangerous EDITF_ATTRIBUTESUBJECTALTNAME2 flag that affects all certificates issued by a CA.

posts.title: ADCS ESC8: HTTP Web Enrollment NTLM Relay
posts.excerpt: Using NTLM relay attacks against AD CS HTTP Web Enrollment endpoints to achieve domain compromise.

posts.title: Advanced Active Directory Enumeration Techniques
posts.excerpt: Deep dive into BloodHound, PowerView, and custom LDAP queries for comprehensive AD reconnaissance.

posts.title: Automating HTB Machine Reconnaissance
posts.excerpt: My custom Python framework for automated enumeration, including port scanning, service detection, and vulnerability assessment.

posts.title: Building an Obsidian Knowledge Base for Pentesting
posts.excerpt: How I organize my penetration testing notes, methodologies, and findings using Obsidian's powerful linking system.

posts.title: DEPI VAPT Track: Lessons from Week 8
posts.excerpt: Reflections on advanced exploitation techniques, report writing, and the practical application of theoretical knowledge.
